result.execSummary:
The defendant James H Mohr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE will have a payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing 7-01-15

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
